Content:: Occupational Safety and Health Convention, 1981 is an International Labour Organization Convention, number 155. It was established in 1981, with the preamble stating: Having decided upon the adoption of certain proposals with regard to safety and health and the working environment,...[1] In 2002, an additional protocol was adopted to this convention.[2] As of May 2016, the convention had been ratified by 65 states, ten of which have also ratified the additional protocol.[3]  This article related to a treaty is a stub.
